getting_started.title: Getting started
getting_started.description: Learn how to quickly apply Mockado to your projects

api_reference.title: API reference
api_reference.description: Find a complete list of accessories and options

presentation.title: Fictional data, for realists.
presentation.description: Mockado is an open source JavaScript library that provides random data in a simple way, making it ideal for use in automated testing environments and databases. Its use is extremely simple and allows easy customization of the desired outputs. With Mockado, you can easily generate emails and passwords with specific lengths, whether or not they include numbers, as well as define usernames based on gender or the desired number of characters.

getting_started_page.title: Starting

sub_title.text: Start using Mockado and learn by exploring

getting_started_page.description: Mockado comes to help you with your developments in test environments or any other scenario where you need fictitious data. Our modules can be easily used by calling functions responsible for providing each type of data, as well as customizing according to your needs.

section_installation.title: installation
section_installation.description: Mockado is available for download from the npm registry. Use your preferred package manager:

description.text_before: Import the mocked module to have access to all available functions to generate realistic random data, such as: username, email, password and password (see
description.text_after: for a complete list of available accessories).

api_reference_page.title: API reference
api_reference_page.description: Below is a complete list of options and accessories that the Mockado module functions support. Some settings can be passed directly as a parameter, others can only be passed in the options parameter with key and value.

section_name.description_gender: Set the gender you want for random name generator.
section_name.description_type: Set the type you want for random name generator.

features_page.title: Features
features_page.description: Mockado always returns default data. To receive personalized data, you need to pass your preferences as a parameter. The type of data returned varies depending on the function called. Below are examples of basic use.

fullName.title: Full Name
fullName.description: Get a full name without gender

email_with_defined_domain.title: Email with defined domain
email_with_defined_domain.description: Get a email with defined domain.

email_with_defined_domain_and_gender.title: Email with defined domain and gender
email_with_defined_domain_and_gender.description: Get a email with defined domain and gender.

date_between_a_specified_start_and_end.title: Date between a specified start and end
date_between_a_specified_start_and_end.description: Get a date between a specified start and end.

phone_number_with_specified_code.title: Phone Number with specified code
phone_number_with_specified_code.description: Get a phone number with specified code.
